description: Beyond the configurated Mac usage

event.Summary: MAC usage $v5 exceeded configured limit of $v6

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacUsageRaisingThreshold HUAWEI-BASE-TRAP-MIB::hwBaseTrapSeverity i 1 HUAWEI-BASE-TRAP-MIB::hwBaseTrapProbableCause i 1 HUAWEI-BASE-TRAP-MIB::hwBaseTrapEventType i 1 ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacEntityUsage i 0 HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacEntityUsageThreshold i 0

description: To describe the level of trap.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BASE-TRAP-MIB::hwBaseTrapSeverity

description: To describe the probable cause of trap.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BASE-TRAP-MIB::hwBaseTrapProbableCause

description: To describe the type of trap.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BASE-TRAP-MIB::hwBaseTrapEventType

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: MAC usage in every IO board
variables.name: HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacEntityUsage

description: MAC usage range
variables.name: HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacEntityUsageThreshold

description: Resume the alarm of Mac usage

event.Summary: MAC usage $v5 resumed to normal

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwPortSecRcvInsecurePktAlarm IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwPortSecurityProtectAction i 1

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: The port security protect action of this entry. The
meanings of the values are:
restrict(1)- shutdown the port
protect(2)- discard the unknow source mac packets and not learn
shutdown(3)- send trap
noaction(4)- broadcast the packet .
variables.name: HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwPortSecurityProtectAction

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacLimitRuleNumRaisingThreshold ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacRuleDynAddressLearnNum i 9999 HUAWEI-L2MAM-MIB::hwMacLimitRuleMaxMac i 9999

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The index for this entry.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The board can receive pst broadcast packet from other boards in one minute.

event.Summary: Board resumed receiving PST broadcast packets
